description:
The crash occurred in the eastbound lane of a two-lane roadway with a T-intersection.
                        Conditions were dusk and dry in the evening on a weekend. The northbound lane had a posted speed
                        limit of 40 kmph (25 mph) and the eastbound lane had a posted speed limit of 56 kmph (35 mph).


                        V1 was a 2003 Hyundai Elantra sedan traveling eastbound in the right lane approaching a
                        T-intersection. V2, a 1998 Ford Taurus sedan, was traveling northbound in the right lane
                        approaching a stop sign intending on turning left. V2 stopped at the stop sign, looked in both
                        directions but there was landscaping and a fence obstructing V2's view. V2 then proceeded to
                        turn left and the front of V1 struck the left side of V2 in the intersection., as V1 passed by
                        V2, V2's right front contacted the back of V1. V1 continued on and struck a curb and a tree. V1
                        came to final rest facing eastbound. V2 continued on and struck a curb and came to final rest
                        facing northwest.


                        V1 was driven by a 61-year-old female who sustained moderate injuries and was transported to a
                        local hospital. She stated that she was traveling eastbound and saw V2 turn in front of her. The
                        driver of V1 braked and swerved left but struck the left side of V2. V1 was towed due to damage.


                        The Critical Precrash Event for V1 was other vehicle encroachment from crossing street turning
                        into opposite direction. The Critical Reason for the Critical Precrash Event was not coded to
                        this vehicle. Associated factors coded to this driver include several physical ailments such as
                        high blood pressure, diabetes and asthma. The driver of V1 also takes several medications for
                        these ailments. The driver is familiar with the roadway.


                        V2 was driven by a 26-year-old female who was not injured. She stated that she stopped at the
                        stop sign, looked in both directions but was unable to see V1 because of a fence and landscaping
                        obstruction. V2 intending on turning left but was struck by V1. V2 was towed due to damage.


                        The Critical Precrash Event for V2 was this vehicle turning left at the intersection. The
                        Critical Reason for the Critical Precrash Event was an environmental related factor; view
                        obstructed by a fence and landscaping. Associated factors coded to this driver was a recognition
                        factor; driver was conversing with the passenger, inadequate surveillance; looked but did not
                        see, the driver being unlicensed. The driver was familiar with the roadway.
